content:
WmpBitmapEncoder Class

Definition

Defines an encoder that is used to encode Microsoft Windows Media Photo images.

In this Article

public sealed class WmpBitmapEncoder : System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder
Inheritance
Object
DispatcherObject
BitmapEncoder
WmpBitmapEncoder

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)

ColorContexts

Palette

Thumbnail
CheckAccess()
Dispatcher
VerifyAccess()

Remarks

Windows Media Photo is a new codec that provides better image fidelity than JPEG with smaller file sizes and more features. Windows Media Photo images achieve lossy and lossless compression by using a single algorithm. Windows Media Photo images support existing metadata standards. For additional information about this format, see Windows Media Photo Specification.

Windows Media Photo files do not support preview, global thumbnails, frame level thumbnails, or multiple frames.

Encoding does not work in partial trust. See WPF Partial Trust Security for information on partial trust.

XAML Text Usage

Constructors

WmpBitmapEncoder()

Initializes a new instance of the WmpBitmapEncoder class.

public WmpBitmapEncoder ();
Attributes
SecurityCriticalAttribute

Properties

AlphaDataDiscardLevel

Gets or sets the level of alpha frequency data to discard during a compressed domain transcode.

public byte AlphaDataDiscardLevel { get; set; }
Value
Byte

The level of alpha data to discard when encoding the image. The value range is 0 (no data discarded) to 4 (alpha channel completely discarded). The default is 1.

Value
 Description
0
 No image frequency data is discarded.
1
 FlexBits are discarded. The image quality of the image is reduced without changing the effective resolution of the image.
2
 HighPass frequency data band is discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 4 in both dimensions.
3
 HighPass and LowPass frequency data bands are discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 16 in both dimensions.
4
 The alpha channel is completely discarded. The pixel format is changed to reflect the removal of the alpha channel.
Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value given is not between 0 and 4.

Remarks

This property has an effect only if CompressedDomainTranscode is set to true and the image contains either a planar or interleaved alpha channel; otherwise, it is ignored.

XAML Text Usage

AlphaQualityLevel

Gets or sets the compression quality for a planar alpha channel.

public byte AlphaQualityLevel { get; set; }
Value
Byte

The compression quality for a planar alpha channel image. A value of 1 is considered lossless, and increasing values result in higher compression ratios and lower image quality. The value range is 1 to 255. The default is 1.

Remarks

This property has an effect only if InterleavedAlpha is false.

XAML Text Usage

CompressedDomainTranscode

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether compressed domain operations can be used. Compressed domain operations are transformation operations that are done without decoding the image data.

public bool CompressedDomainTranscode { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if compressed domain operations can be used; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

FlipHorizontal

Gets or sets a value indicating whether to flip the image horizontally.

public bool FlipHorizontal { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the image is to be flipped horizontally; otherwise, false.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

FlipVertical

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to flip the image vertically.

public bool FlipVertical { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the image is to be flipped vertically; otherwise, false.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

FrequencyOrder

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to encoding in frequency order.

public bool FrequencyOrder { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to encode the image in frequency order; false to encode the image by its spatial orientation. The default is true.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

HorizontalTileSlices

Gets or sets the number of horizontal divisions to use during compression encoding. A single division creates two horizontal regions.

public short HorizontalTileSlices { get; set; }
Value
Int16

The number of horizontal divisions to use during compression encoding. The value range is 0 to 4095. The default is 0.

Remarks

If CompressedDomainTranscode is true, HorizontalTileSlices must be set to 0.

A tile created by the division can never be smaller than 16 pixels. The value is adjusted to maintain the minimum tile size.

When used in combination with VerticalTileSlices, a grid of tiles is formed. For example, if both properties are set to 1, the image is divided into 4 tiles.

XAML Text Usage

IgnoreOverlap

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to ignore region overlap pixels in subregion compressed domain encoding. This feature is not currently implemented.

public bool IgnoreOverlap { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if overlap is ignored; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

This value is valid only when CompressedDomainTranscode is true and a subregion encode is requested.

XAML Text Usage

ImageDataDiscardLevel

Gets or sets the level of image data to discard during a compressed domain transcode.

public byte ImageDataDiscardLevel { get; set; }
Value
Byte

The level of image data to discard during a compressed domain encoding of the image. The value range is 0 (no data discarded) to 3 (HighPass and LowPass discarded). The default is 1.

Value
 Description
0
 No image frequency data is discarded.
1
 FlexBits are discarded. The image quality of the image is reduced without changing the effective resolution of the image.
2
 HighPass frequency data band is discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 4 in both dimensions.
3
 HighPass and LowPass frequency data bands are discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 16 in both dimensions.
Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value given is not between 0 and 3.

Remarks

This property has an effect only if CompressedDomainTranscode is set to true; otherwise, it is ignored.

XAML Text Usage

ImageQualityLevel

Gets or sets the image quality level.

public float ImageQualityLevel { get; set; }
Value
Single

The image quality level. The range is 0 to 1.0 (lossless image quality). The default is 0.9.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

InterleavedAlpha

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to encode the alpha channel data as an additional interleaved channel.

public bool InterleavedAlpha { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the image is encoded with an additional interleaved alpha channel; false if planar alpha channel is used. The default is false.

Remarks

Interleaved alpha channels are only supported by certain pixel formats.

XAML Text Usage

Lossless

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to encode using lossless compression.

public bool Lossless { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to use lossless compression; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

OverlapLevel

Gets or sets the overlap processing level.

public byte OverlapLevel { get; set; }
Value
Byte

The overlap processing level. The default is 1.

Value
 Description
0
 No overlap processing is enabled.
1
 One level of overlap processing is enabled. Encoded values of 4x4 blocks are modified based on the values of neighboring blocks.
2
 Two levels of overlap processing are enabled. In addition to the first level of processing, encoded values of 16x16 macro blocks are modified based on the values of neighboring macro blocks.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

QualityLevel

Gets or sets the compression quality for the main image.

public byte QualityLevel { get; set; }
Value
Byte

The compression quality for the main image. A value of 1 is considered lossless, and higher values indicate a high compression ratio and lower image quality. The range is 1 to 255. The default is 1.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

Rotation

Gets or sets the Rotation of the image.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation Rotation { get; set; }
Value
Rotation

The rotation of the image.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

SubsamplingLevel

Gets or sets the sub-sampling level for RGB image encoding.

public byte SubsamplingLevel { get; set; }
Value
Byte

The sub-sampling level for RGB image encoding. The range is 0 to 3. The default is 3.

Value
 Description
0
 4:0:0 encoding. Chroma content is discarded; luminance is preserved.
1
 4:2:0 encoding. Chroma resolution is reduced by 1/4 of luminance resolution.
2
 4:2:2 encoding. Chroma resolution is reduced to 1/2 of luminance resolution.
3
 4:4:4 encoding. Chroma resolution is preserved.
Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value given is not between 0 and 3.

Remarks

XAML Text Usage

UseCodecOptions

Gets or sets a value that indicates codec options are to be used.

public bool UseCodecOptions { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if codec options are to be used; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

When UseCodecOptions is true, QualityLevel, OverlapLevel, and SubsamplingLevel are used in place of the ImageQualityLevel.

When UseCodecOptions is false, QualityLevel, OverlapLevel, and SubsamplingLevel are set based on ImageQualityLevel.

XAML Text Usage

VerticalTileSlices

Gets or sets the number of vertical divisions to use during compression encoding. A single division creates two vertical regions.

public short VerticalTileSlices { get; set; }
Value
Int16

The number of vertical divisions to use during compression encoding. The value range is 0 to 4095. The default is 0.

Remarks

If CompressedDomainTranscode is true, VerticalTileSlices must be set to 0.

A tile created by the division can never be smaller than 16 pixels. The value is adjusted to maintain the minimum tile size.

When used in combination with HorizontalTileSlices, a grid of tiles is formed. For example, if both properties are set to 1, the image is divided into 4 tiles.

XAML Text Usage
